photos.desc: Navigating to the hotel presented some challenges.
Asking the locals for directions, they said 'turn around and avoid the river flood.'
The river flood the locals warned about. The truck crew in front of us is sizing it up.
Amazingly the truck crew made it, but another rental car did not. We listened to the locals and turned around.
After 12hr of traveling, we finally arrived!
Our first sunset and Pina Coladas of the trip.
Our Margaritaville hotel was sadly not up to our standards, so we took quick action and negotiated a refund. We passed a nice Westin resort on the way into town, and checked in there instead.
Our Westin resort. We stayed here enjoying the all-inclusive/care-free resort lifestyle for the first few days of the trip.
We visisted during the off-season which made the resort much more private and romantic!
Enjoying our first all-inclusive breakfast.
The resort was full of wildlife.
Eating at our favorite restaurant at the resort. They had great seafood and service.
The resort left us a little special something for our first night.
Mary Kate enjoyed the resort's spa.
Sean at the pool, protecting his sunburn from the first day.
At our favorite restaurant for the 2nd night in a row.
We came prepared for rainy season with our panchos.
Mary Kate spent the mornings painting.
Sean planning for our volcano trip we took a few days later.
These little guys would hang out with us right outside our villa.
This howler monkey sounded like a he was as large as a grizzly bear.
Our resort had direct access to the beautiful Playa Conchal beach.
We setup hammocks for a beach day full of swimming and napping. THANK YOU for the hammocks Aunt Karen!
On our way to the volcano park, a man was juggling machetes in the street.
Our first venture outside of the resort was to the beautiful Rincon de la Vieja volcanic national park.
This mud pit felt like something out of the Jurassic Park movies and had a strong smell of sulfur.
After our hike we bought a day pass to a nearby hot spring.
We stopped for a quick McDonald's cone on our way back to the resort.
Costa Rican roads were filled with classic cars like this Toyota Land Cruiser.
Our next day trip was to Playa Avellanas for some surfing and beach-side painting.
The waves were small, but the warm water was a huge improvement over the cold waters of Sean's local San Francisco break.
After surfing we ate at Lola's restaurant, famous for its pet pigs that roam its beachfront property.
On our way back we stopped in Tamarindo for dinner at THE ROOF restaurant, which was on a roof with a good view.
For our last day at the resort, a bartender we made friends with made us his homemade special rum punch.
This iguana hanged out with us poolside for a solid 20 minutes. It was a great way to connect with nature, and Sean also thinks he'd probably taste pretty good on a stick.
These birds were cute but also really dumb. They kept trying to drink Mary Kate's paint.
Our last night out at the resort.
We were on an empty plane on our trip home and had some room to play cards.
